snippet: The Foreign Intelligence Surveillance Court released a new legal opinion on Friday that reauthorized the once-secret National Security Agency program that keeps records of every American’s phone calls.
abstract: Foreign Intelligence Surveillance Court releases new legal opinion that reauthorizes once-secret National Security Agency program that keeps records of every American’s phone calls; Judge Mary A McLaughlin says she is personally approving for first time the extension of the call log metadata program, which must be approved every 90 days.
lead_paragraph: The Foreign Intelligence Surveillance Court released a new legal opinion on Friday that reauthorized the once-secret National Security Agency program that keeps records of every American’s phone calls.

headline.main: N.S.A. Plan to Log Calls Is Renewed by Court
headline.print_headline:
N.S.A. Plan
To Log Calls
Is Renewed
By Court
